intro: Sorindeia lastoursvillensis, commonly known as the Lastoursville sorindeia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes species such as cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Its fruit is a drupe, typically containing a single seed, and it plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing food for various wildlife. Due to its restricted range and habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species.
